byline: By Valeria Escobar and Dia Gill Data reporting and graphics by Mike Fu and Raeedah Wahid Produced by Hong Sen Du

Raeedah Wahid is the Graphics editor at Spectator. She can be contacted at raeedah.wahid@columbiaspectator.com. Follow her on Twitter @raeedahwahid.

Hong Sen Du is a developer at Spectator. He can be contacted at hongsen.du@columbiaspectator.com.

methodology: About the numbers Using Google’s Place API, we can convert an address of a hospital to its respective latitude and longitude. Since Open Data NTA Tabulation Areas represents each neighborhood as a polygon with vertices consisting of latitude and longitude, we can locate the neighborhood of each hospital using its latitude and longitude. We then retrieved the median income by zip code, and matched it with the corresponding neighborhood using the Place APi. To determine the accessibility of a hospital by walking… Used 0.2, 0.3, 0.5 mi 0.3 representing walkable distance 0.5 is overstretched Assumed variables from research: https://scholarcommons.sc.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=5148&context=etd There may be discrepancies between the numbers of beds reported by NY State Department of Health and hospitals themselves. Spectator did not represent updated hospital bed numbers as a result of the COVID-19 outbreak because numbers are in constant flux. View our data collection and analysis here. Text
footer: Produced with Spectate by the Spectator Graphics team.
